Multiple reports and videos emerged feat: 2. Twitter users, such as @Piznack and @Kaydi_K, shared videos and tweets describing the phenomenon of water being sucked away by the hurricane.
A city official in Clearwater: Florida, captured the strange phenomenon on video and shared it on social media.
Jamie Rhome: a storm surge specialist at the National Hurricane Center, confirmed that Hurricane Irma had caused a meteorological phenomenon called "negative surge."
